p: MICs and MFCs values for pistachio hull EO and three antifungal compounds were determined (Table 2). Results of negative controls using DMSO as a solvent at the concentration of 1% ( v/v) indicated the complete absence of inhibition of all the strains tested (data not shown). Pistachio hull EO was active against all strains tested, C. parapsilosis strains being the most sensitive (complete inhibition achieved with a concentration of 1.25–2.50 mg/ml), followed by C. glabrata strains (complete inhibition achieved with a concentration of 1.25–5.0 mg/ml) and C. albicans strains (complete inhibition achieved with a concentration of 5.0 mg/ml). The effect of pistachio hull EO was fungicidal against all tested strains. Interestingly, all clinical strains of C. albicans and1 strain of C. glabrata (strain 33) were resistant to both voriconazole and fluconazole.
